title: 3 Ways to Change Your Profile Picture on Facebook

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. Tap the Facebook app icon, which resembles a white "f" on a dark-blue background. This will open your Facebook News Feed if you're logged in. If you aren't logged in, enter your email address and password before proceeding.

steps.title: Tap the "Profile" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Profile" icon. It's a person-shaped icon at the bottom of the screen. Doing so opens your profile page. [1] X Research source If you don't see this icon, you can instead tap ☰ in the bottom-right corner of the screen and then tap your name at the top of the resulting menu.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. You'll find it at the top of the profile page. Tapping it prompts a pop-up menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Select Profile Picture.
steps.content: Tap Select Profile Picture . It's in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Take a new profile photo.
steps.content: Take a new profile photo. Tap the camera icon in the top-right corner of the screen, then take a picture of yourself by tapping the "Capture" button at the bottom of the screen. [3] X Research source If you want to select an existing photo for your profile picture, scroll down until you find the album from which you want to select a photo, tap More in the top-right corner of the album's section if necessary, and tap the photo you want to use.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This option is in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so changes your profile picture to your newly selected one. If you want to edit your profile picture, tap Edit below the profile picture and then edit your photo as needed. You can add a themed frame to your profile image by tapping ADD FRAME and then selecting the frame you want to use.

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. Tap the Facebook app icon, which resembles a white "f" on a dark-blue background. This will open your Facebook News Feed if you're logged in. If you aren't logged in, enter your email address and password before proceeding.

steps.title: Tap the "Profile" icon.
steps.content: Tap the "Profile" icon. It's in the upper-left corner of the screen. This will open your profile page. [4] X Research source If you don't see the profile icon in the upper-left corner, tap ☰ in the upper-right corner of the screen and then tap your name.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. This is at the top of your profile page. Doing so opens a menu. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Select Profile Picture.
steps.content: Tap Select Profile Picture . It's in the menu. [6] X Research source You may have to tap ALLOW before proceeding if this is your first time adding a photo from your Android.

steps.title: Take a new profile photo.
steps.content: Take a new profile photo. Tap the camera icon in the upper-left side of the CAMERA ROLL tab, tap ALLOW if prompted, and take a picture of yourself using the "Capture" button at the bottom of the screen. If you'd rather select a profile photo, tap one of the photos on the CAMERA ROLL tab, or tap one of the other tabs (e.g., PHOTOS OF YOU ) at the top of the screen and then select the photo you want to use.

steps.title: Tap USE.
steps.content: Tap USE . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. Doing so will set the photo as your profile picture. If you want to edit your profile picture, tap Edit in the lower-left side of the screen and then edit your photo as needed. You can add a themed frame to your profile image by tapping ADD FRAME and then selecting the frame you want to use.

steps.title: Open Facebook.
steps.content: Open Facebook. Go to https://www.facebook.com in your computer's web browser. This will open your Facebook News Feed if you're logged in. If you aren't logged in, enter your email address and password before proceeding.

steps.title: Click your profile thumbnail.
steps.content: Click your profile thumbnail. It's to the right of the search bar at the top of the window, next to your name. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Hover the pointer over your profile picture.
steps.content: Hover the pointer over your profile picture. Doing so causes an Update Profile Picture option to appear on the profile image.

steps.title: Click Update Profile Picture.
steps.content: Click Update Profile Picture . You should see this appear at the bottom of your current profile picture.

steps.title: Choose a photo.
steps.content: Choose a photo. You can either select a photo from your existing Facebook photos or you can upload a new one: [8] X Research source Existing photo — Scroll through your existing Facebook photos, then click the one you want to make your profile picture. Click See More to the right of each section of photos to see more images in its album. New photo — Click Upload Photo at the top of the pop-up window, then select the photo file you want to add.

steps.title: Adjust your photo.
steps.content: Adjust your photo. If needed, do one or both of the following: Drag the photo to reposition it in the frame. Use the slider at the bottom of the dialog box to increase or decrease the size of the image.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . It's in the bottom-left corner of the window. Doing so sets your selected image as your new profile picture.
